neighbors.name: Braden B H & Son Limited Partnership

approach_recommendations.engage: See ORG table for engagement information.

neighbors.name: Norma S. Braden
neighbors.claims: Norma S. Braden (1931–2026) was a longtime Rome resident who was a founding member of Woodlawn Baptist Church and served as President of multiple local clubs such as the Spade and Trowel Garden Club [Coosa Valley News](https://coosavalleynews.com/2026/01/mrs-norma-sheffield-braden-age-94-rome/). She passed away on January 8, 2026, at the age of 94 [Coosa Valley News](https://coosavalleynews.com/2026/01/mrs-norma-sheffield-braden-age-94-rome/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Work through her surviving family (especially her son Mark Braden) since she is now deceased. Emphasize respect for the Braden family’s long history and contributions in Floyd County.

neighbors.name: Mark H. Braden
neighbors.claims: Mark H. Braden resides in Rome, Georgia, and is a son of the late Norma S. Braden [Coosa Valley News](https://coosavalleynews.com/2026/01/mrs-norma-sheffield-braden-age-94-rome/). In 2021, the Braden family sold over 202 acres of their land along Highway 411 to local authorities for an industrial development corridor [WRGA](https://www.wrganews.com/2021/08/10/rome-floyd-county-announces-highway-411-land-purchase/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage a local development official who worked with Mark on the Highway 411 project to reach out. Emphasize how the new project’s community benefits and local oversight align with the economic progress his family has supported.

overview_summary: Among the three neighbors, one (Mark Braden) has actively supported development, while the others have no recorded stance. None hold public office, but the Braden family’s long-standing presence as landowners and community members gives them moderate influence locally.
